column4: hey, i was wondering whether there was a tool that could show the current up/down load rate of the computer? (i am using an umts stick an really need to watch my "consumption")
iptraffic for real time 'visual view' in a terminal, otherwise ifconfig tells you how much has been sent/recv on all your different network interfaces
otherwise, Gnome, KDE and XFCE (and presumably other DEs) have widgets for their panels which track network up/down rates in real time
but the best I've ever come across for your purposes was gkrellm's network monitor
